title: AirPods airplane adapter makes in-flight entertainment sound great
description: Don't resort to freebie earbuds for airplane movies. Get the Eve II, a Bluetooth adapter that lets you use AirPods on airplanes. (via Cult of Mac - Apple news, rumors, reviews and how-tos)
author: Cult of Mac Deals
excerpt: Don't resort to freebie earbuds for airplane movies. Get the Eve II, a Bluetooth adapter that lets you use AirPods on airplanes.
text: Deals Use your AirPods to hear the plane's in-flight movies with this inexpensive Bluetooth transmitter and receiver. Photo: Cult of Mac Deals Even in 2025, most in-flight entertainment systems don’t offer Bluetooth connections. But with this affordable Bluetooth adapter, you can pop in your AirPods and enjoy your choice of the airline’s featured movies, TV shows and music in a glorious state of noise-cancellation-induced bliss. That’s way better than packing an additional pair of wired headphones or using (or even purchasing) a crappy pair of earbuds on the plane. That’s why this Eve II Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver is such a useful device for travelers. Perfect for any upcoming air travel, it’s on sale now for only $42.97 (regularly $59) with free shipping. Bluetooth adapter: Make in-flight entertainment awesome with AirPods If using random earbuds that don’t sound good and/or continuously fall out seems unappealing to you, you’re not alone.  Specially made to be compatible with airline entertainment systems, the Eve II measures just 1.6 inches by 0.5 inches by 1.8 inches. You can pack the tiny Bluetooth adapter in your backpack or toss it into your pocket so you can use your AirPods to stay entertained throughout your flight. Its folding dual-3.5 mm aux plugs let you connect to regular single jacks or those two-hole ones that airplane manufacturers sometimes use just to irritate you. The dongle employs Bluetooth 5.3 for solid wireless connections, and it works with two sets of AirPods (or other wireless earbuds/headphones) at a time. You’ll get up to 20 hours of battery life on a charge, which will come in handy during long trips. Plus, the Bluetooth adapter’s 32-foot wireless range should prove more than sufficient for almost any scenario. Use it with a pair of the latest AirPods Pro with USB-C case for the ultimate in-flight comfort and noise cancellation. Bluetooth adapter works with TVs, home and car stereos, and more Adam Elements’ Eve II receiver and transmitter is not limited to airplanes, either. In fact, versatility is key with this affordable Bluetooth adapter. This AirPods airplane adapter is also compatible with various audio devices, from TVs and home stereos to car audio systems. It’s easy to use, and effectively bridges the gap between your favorite wireless gadgets and older devices that don’t come with built-in Bluetooth. Save on a versatile Eve II Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver Don’t miss this opportunity to elevate and streamline your audio experience in the air and elsewhere. Get the Eve II Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver for just $42.97 with free shipping. No coupon necessary to save on an airplane adapter for AirPods and other Bluetooth earbuds/headphones. Buy from: Cult of Mac Deals Prices subject to change. All sales handled by StackSocial, our partner who runs Cult of Mac Deals. For customer support, please email StackSocial directly. We originally published this post on the Eve II Bluetooth adapter on February 12, 2024. We updated the info.
html:
• Deals

Even in 2025, most in-flight entertainment systems don’t offer Bluetooth connections. But with this affordable Bluetooth adapter, you can pop in your AirPods and enjoy your choice of the airline’s featured movies, TV shows and music in a glorious state of noise-cancellation-induced bliss.

That’s way better than packing an additional pair of wired headphones or using (or even purchasing) a crappy pair of earbuds on the plane. That’s why this Eve II Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver is such a useful device for travelers. Perfect for any upcoming air travel, it’s on sale now for only $42.97 (regularly $59) with free shipping.

Bluetooth adapter: Make in-flight entertainment awesome with AirPods

If using random earbuds that don’t sound good and/or continuously fall out seems unappealing to you, you’re not alone.  Specially made to be compatible with airline entertainment systems, the Eve II measures just 1.6 inches by 0.5 inches by 1.8 inches. You can pack the tiny Bluetooth adapter in your backpack or toss it into your pocket so you can use your AirPods to stay entertained throughout your flight.

Its folding dual-3.5 mm aux plugs let you connect to regular single jacks or those two-hole ones that airplane manufacturers sometimes use just to irritate you. The dongle employs Bluetooth 5.3 for solid wireless connections, and it works with two sets of AirPods (or other wireless earbuds/headphones) at a time.

You’ll get up to 20 hours of battery life on a charge, which will come in handy during long trips. Plus, the Bluetooth adapter’s 32-foot wireless range should prove more than sufficient for almost any scenario. Use it with a pair of the latest AirPods Pro with USB-C case for the ultimate in-flight comfort and noise cancellation.

Bluetooth adapter works with TVs, home and car stereos, and more

Adam Elements’ Eve II receiver and transmitter is not limited to airplanes, either. In fact, versatility is key with this affordable Bluetooth adapter.

This AirPods airplane adapter is also compatible with various audio devices, from TVs and home stereos to car audio systems. It’s easy to use, and effectively bridges the gap between your favorite wireless gadgets and older devices that don’t come with built-in Bluetooth.

Save on a versatile Eve II Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver

Don’t miss this opportunity to elevate and streamline your audio experience in the air and elsewhere. Get the Eve II Bluetooth Transmitter and Receiver for just $42.97 with free shipping. No coupon necessary to save on an airplane adapter for AirPods and other Bluetooth earbuds/headphones.

Buy from: Cult of Mac Deals

Prices subject to change. All sales handled by StackSocial, our partner who runs Cult of Mac Deals. For customer support, please email StackSocial directly. We originally published this post on the Eve II Bluetooth adapter on February 12, 2024. We updated the info.
